cmCourseInfo.description: Intensive instruction in archaeological field methods and acquisition of field skills, including archaeological search and survey, site mapping, laying out excavation grids, use of theodolites, total station, and GPS, stratigraphic excavation, stratigraphy, field recording, screening sediment, Ontario license and reporting requirements. Normally this course would take place on campus in the summer. This course has a mandatory Lab Materials Fee of $25 to cover non-reusable materials. The fee will be included on the students ACORN invoice.
cmCourseInfo.title: Archaeological Field Methods
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: ANT200Y1 or (NMC260H1 and NMC262H1) or NMC261Y0

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
Please visit the Anthropology website (http://anthropology.utoronto.ca/undergraduate/field-schools-research-opportunities/#ARH306Y) or contact the Undergraduate Administrator, Josie Alaimo, at josie.alaimo@utoronto.ca for more information.

cmCourseInfo.description: Opportunity for students participating in non-degree credit archaeological digs to submit reports, field notes and term papers for degree credit. Not eligible for CR/NCR option.
cmCourseInfo.title: Field Archaeology
cmCourseInfo.prerequisitesText: Permission of Undergraduate Co-ordinator and Supervisor

notes.name: Course Note
notes.content:
Timetable Instructions
To enrol in this course, please contact Josie Alaimo, the Undergraduate Administrator, at josie.alaimo@utoronto.ca
